current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to
		  remove social security account numbers from Medicare identification cards and
		  communications provided to Medicare beneficiaries in order to protect Medicare
		  beneficiaries from identity theft.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Social Security Number Protection Act
			 of 2011

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Requiring the
			 Secretary of Health and Human Services to prohibit the display of social
			 security account numbers on Medicare identification cards and communications
			 provided to Medicare beneficiaries

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish and begin
			 to implement procedures to eliminate the unnecessary collection, use, and
			 display of social security account numbers of Medicare beneficiaries.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text:
Not later than 3 years after the date of the enactment of
			 this Act, the

header.#text:
Medicare cards
			 and communications provided to beneficiaries

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that each
			 newly issued Medicare identification card meets the requirements described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security Number Protection Act of 2011/s:2/ss:b/p:1/sp:C

text.#text:
Not later than 3 years after the date of the enactment of
			 this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure
			 that all Medicare beneficiaries have been issued a Medicare identification card
			 that meets the requirements of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security Number Protection Act of 2011/s:2/ss:b/p:1/sp:C

text.#text:
Not later than 5 years after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, the

The
			 requirements described in this subparagraph are, with respect to a Medicare
			 identification card, that the card does not display or electronically store (in
			 an unencrypted format) a Medicare beneficiary’s social security account
			 number.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 prohibit the display of a Medicare beneficiary’s social security account number
			 on written or electronic communication provided to the beneficiary unless the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines that inclusion of social security account numbers on such
			 communications is essential for the operation of the Medicare program.

text.#text:
Not later than 3 years after the date
			 of the enactment of this Act, the

quote.#tail:
means an individual who is entitled to, or enrolled for,
			 benefits under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: part A of title XVIII of the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following new clause:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 205(c)(2)(C) of the
			 Social Security Act

header.#text:
Conforming
			 reference in the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to prohibit the display of social
				security account numbers on Medicare identification cards and communications
				provided to Medicare beneficiaries, see
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

short-title.#text:
Social Security Number Protection Act of
				2011

			 sums as may be necessary
